Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student can illustrate a plant with some signs of health, like a few green leaves, although details may be missing.
The student can show the difference in basic appearance between a healthy and an unhealthy plant, perhaps via droopy versus upright stems.
The student can include some elements indicating poor health, such as less vibrant leaves or droopiness.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to accurately depict all signs of healthy growth, like flowers or uniformly green leaves (student may miss detailing or color doesn't reflect health).
The student may not clearly show brown spots or other distinct signs of poor health on the plant without water (student doesn't recognize specific signs of dehydration).
The drawing may not fully convey that water is essential for plant life and growth on its own (student might not connect lack of water directly to plant health).
